intro: Galbanon, commonly known as galbanum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant produces a resin that has been historically used in perfumery and traditional medicine. Galbanum thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its botanical significance lies in its unique chemical composition, which includes various volatile oils and terpenes.
